Class Snake

java.lang.Object
  greenfoot.sofiainternal.Actor
      sofia.graphics.Shape
          sofia.graphics.ImageShape
              sofia.micro.Actor
                  Snake

public class Snake
extends sofia.micro.Actor

The Snake class, being the main actor, contains the method for the snake to be able to move around manually. When it eats a food in the world, the snake gets longer by adding blocks following the snake's HeadBlock first then any block following it. Also, when the food is being eaten in the world, another food would be randomly added into the world after colliding with the snake's headblock. When the snake's headblock collides with an obstacle, the game is over.

Version:
2.2.1-14(2013.12.04)
Author:
Christopher Aska Toda (aska192)

          The addBlock() method creates and add new snake blocks, first one that will be following the snake's headblock, then the next blocks will follow its previous blocks by getting their coordinates.

          The dpadEastIsDown() method uses the right-arrow key to rotate 90 degrees right.
 void dpadWestIsDown()
          The dpadWestIsDown() method uses the left-arrow key to rotate 90 degrees left.

 void follow()
          The follow() method gets executed when the snake eats a food, then a block will be added into the world from the list it's being stored in.

Constructor Detail

Snake

public Snake(sofia.micro.World w,
             int x,
             int y)
Creates a new Snake object. Creates an ArrayList of snake blocks after addBlock is executed. When storing the snake blocks as blocks, it would get added into the world after each time the snake eats a food and the snake blocks will follow the snake.

Parameters:
w - The initialized world
x - The x-axis of the snake
y - The y-axis of the snake
Method Detail

act

public void act()
The act() method for the Snake class.

Overrides:
act in class sofia.micro.Actor

addBlock

public void addBlock()
The addBlock() method creates and add new snake blocks, first one that will be following the snake's headblock, then the next blocks will follow its previous blocks by getting their coordinates.

dpadEastIsDown

public void dpadEastIsDown()
The dpadEastIsDown() method uses the right-arrow key to rotate 90 degrees right.

dpadWestIsDown

public void dpadWestIsDown()
The dpadWestIsDown() method uses the left-arrow key to rotate 90 degrees left.

eat

public void eat()
The eat() method is when the snake's headblock collides with a food added into the world, then the food would get removed and more food will be added randomly anywhere into the world. When the snake collides with an obstacle in the world, then the game is over. A big red text around the center would appear and say "Game Over".

follow

public void follow()
The follow() method gets executed when the snake eats a food, then a block will be added into the world from the list it's being stored in.
